Posts.Content: What an awesome thread! Can I join? I'm a walking addict and had a mastectomy and sentinal.node biopsy mid Dec. Im just a few days off those results and walking has been massively helping with pain relief and shifting anxiety. We had a lovely day where I am today and this was my walk this morning.

Best wishes - photos will be on tomorrow. Xx

Off to work today to start phased return. Only admin this week, no teaching so just getting my head round things. Hoping to walk off after lunch in a gesture of rebellion!!! Hope all are well, and for those who love rugby. What a weekend that was!

This sure is a strange end of winter.  In other news I have been a little bit obsessed with making risotto - how could it have been easy all this time and I not know - and my 13 year old boy has cleaned the bathroom for me today - I'm a proud mum.

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: HmmAnnJac  Thinking what else was I glad of - they kept me in over night and it was a huge relief that at the last min I had popped in an eye mask like you might use on an aeroplane. The ward was too bright for me. Also I had some podcasts on my phone and earphones while I waited - I drew the short straw and got the 4pm slot for surgery so was particularly glad of radio on tap.  Now I have 4 pillows for sleeping in a U round me because it stops me rolling which I prefer and a light blanket to pull up to my chin because I found my duvet too heavy to pull up as high as I normally do. Those are personal preferences but have made me happy.  Forgive if you are an expert on this game already or if too much detail but those are the things that made a big difference to me.

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Hi sideways61 I had to reply to your question!  I was walking 1 - 2 hours about 3x per week up to op so that was my baseline  I had a rt side mastectomy on 13th Dec. I walked 10 mins on 14th Dec. I did no walking on 15th Dec as it was bitter cold and the cold has such an effect on muscles post op. Then 16th I tried 20 mins but got a bit dizzy and had to go slow. 17th 15 mins on a little flat road. 19th I walked for over an hour. Was amazing but probably a mistake.  By 2 weeks post op an hour was ok as long as I then rested. I have to say I sat down for almost all of the time that I wasnt walking for the first 3 weeks. Im 9 weeks post op and can walk 3 hours in a stretch now.  It is so individual and I'm a bit of a nutter. I pushed myself harder than I needed to now that I look back. I think I just needed to then. A bit less than I describe woukd be wiser! The thing that I would definitely say is that going in the car bothered my back so that meant that travelling to walk confused the issue. Also flat predictable surfaces are a very good idea. Unpredictable uneven surfaces and gradients caused me a lot of pain very quickly- for me it worked to walk using my core as little as possible. Hope that is helpful.  Also going to bed for a week works very well for some.

Posts.Content: Morning WhatHappened Sorry about the being awake so middleofthenight - hope you got some.good sleep eventually. I think that the variation in how the hill goes is totally normal; my sporty friends say that running is like that: thw same challenge can feel totally different on different days. Apparently it can be related to water and sleep - ie whether you are hydrated or dehydrated from more cups of tea than glasses of water!  Meeting a friend for a walk and coffee today. No sun forecast up here for today but at least it doesnt look like it will be too cold. Good luck for a good day. Hope the hill is kind!

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Ah AnnJac Your poor body must be using so much energy healing. I had two bleeds from my wound and both were utterly exhausting. So much healing to do. Xxx It makes your legs so heavy. I was fast asleep at 7:30 last night and was completely disoriented at 8:30 when my son and hubby came from a sports thing. I had no idea why they would be awake before me when I am always awake hours before the house. Nothing is your fault. Left hand and right hand. Not you. God bless that nurse and all like them. The system doesn't know if we should be leaning on the hospital or the GPs does it. Just lean everywhere I reckon. I don't know if you are a multivit person - I'm not as a rule but I took one with iron in it with a glass of orange juice on a regular basis for a couple of months. I think it might have helped.  I really hope you get a good day tomorrow. Today has been better my end. Have finally cooked the piles of rhubarb and pumpkin that I meant to cook a week ago so the boy had rhubarb and custard with his dinner and I had pumpkin and coriander soup for lunch. All will be well. Xx

I feel all sorts of strange things, like a fraud and neither well nor ill and a few other in between things.  In narnia terms Im in the woods between the worlds. Xx

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Little dog walk today as yesterday was quite a long walk. Here are the lovelies.  Swimming costume foray was a huge success. I went to a shop in Leeds called Nicola Jane. I knew that it existed on line but was amazed that I live 20 mins drive from an actual shop. They only sell underwear and swimmimg costumes for women who have had mastectomies, and prosthetics. I'm very pleased with the result! How excited one can get over something that one used to take for granted. Hope the sun is shining everywhere else - even though I am just admiring it from a warm lounge today!

Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Awesome 16km walk round the Harewood estate. It was windy and wild and very invigorating!!! Met this rather scary lady on our way.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Such gorgeous photos everyone! Goes to prove that English spring is truly awesome!!!  Today I have been walking around school and not much else. Yesterday I took my mum some flowers and we had a lovely walk in their village.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Lovely little walk on Harrogate Stray today. Such lovely pictures of everyone's walks. I do feel the loss of the whole day to choose from now that I am back at work - I can't pop out when it clears as easily any more. Let's hope that we are in for some consistently warmer weather soon. I'm off to Spain on Monday (getting excited now). So I will posting some super gorgeous pics soon!  Xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Ah lovely ladies: after a terribly busy week at work this thread is such a consolation. I thought you might like a pic of the wild garlic in flower that I took on my work home today.  I hope you all have a peaceful weekend planned. I have a very sad funeral tomorrow but I have building up to it for a couple of weeks so I think it will be a relief to have had the funeral.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Evening lovely people, hasnt this weather been lovely. No big pics right now - have been spending all my outdoor time trying to kick my allotment into shape. I found the lump that is no more in Oct when I was tackling the winter clearout and never really got it cleared as a consequence. AnnJac Im so sorry that it is taking so long - here's hoping that you will have a little accelerate in the healing now that the sun has come out. Violetsniff I love Monty Don - my favourite gardener. So here is a little snap from the urban walk that I took the dogs on today.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Ah AnnJac bless you. Im sorry - retirement is a such a rite of passage. I hope you can have some sense of the significance and celebration of it at some point. Xx Beautiful still water and warm light at Eccup reservoir this evening in my little evening walk. What a lovely day. You are all such a lovely support - I get excited when a walk has a beautiful view so that I can photograph it. I hope that everyone has got all the joy out of today that was available. I'm really excited that we have two more days of the sun. My phased return means I dont work tomorrow. Hurray for being out in thw sun. Xx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Morning all, My walk was from the physio to see a friend for a coffee today. My lovely friend gave me a couple of private physio sessions which must sound horribly indulgent but has been has been amazing. She specialises in post mastectomy care and I have found the exercises that she has given me very useful. It has also been interesting to talk to her. She was very clear today that I dont even need to think about why I'm so tired. She said think.of all the healing your body is still doing: of course you are exhausted. I found that very helpful because it is nearly 3 months since my op now and I really really want to be better!! I hope all are well - AnnJac how goes the healing?
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: The walk to work this morning! Ignoring the wind it was super pretty. Hope all are doing ok.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: Long time no post - mad busy week. Hitting my 10000 steps in Scotland on my son's rugby tour. Windy but aunny and lovely today.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: AnnJac Totally awesome hat!!! Rugby was an absolute tonic thank you! Yes back at work and an increase of hours this week. Fingers crossed that it turns put to be manageable! A week and a half till the easter holidays now. Looking forward to it hugely. Managed an after school walk today to see the deer at Harewood. Didn't photograph them this time - but got a lovely shot across the valley.
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: AnnJac sorry to hear of continuing slow healing. I really hope that underneath the deeper healing is coming on steadily regardless of hitches at a surface level. seaspirit44 I am currently in a town that trades on wind ao I'm trying to see the benefits. A bit of a nuisance though!!! Violetsniff I love to think of you crafting and nattering - I have brought all I need for the next blanket on holiday with me!  Can't quite believe that I'm only 2 days in Spain but here is today's walk along the coast in windy Tarifa.And a little pic of a lovely square when we went for a walk to explore in Estapona.  I hope everyone is well - will post more pics tomorrow - I managed 235 active mins today so this tourism lark ia keeping my steps up!!
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness

Posts.Content: seaspirit44 So pleased for the good news! xxx
Posts.Title: Walking back to Happiness
